title: Huge Arsenal fan Piers Morgan will wear Spurs shirt if £50,000 is raised for Comic Relief
text:
Huge Arsenal fan Piers Morgan will wear Spurs shirt if £50,000 is raised for Comic Relief The active Tweeter and proud Gunners fan could be left red faced on Red Nose Day Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsenal fan Piers Morgan may wear Spurs shirt for charity Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Huge Arsenal fan and opinionated presenter Piers Morgan has agreed to wear a Spurs shirt on one condition - £50,000 must be raised for Comic Relief by 8am on Red Nose Day. 
The Good Morning Britain presenter is well known for his outspoken thoughts on Arsenal, and for his hate of bitter rivals Spurs. 
Morgan initially made a pledge to come off Twitter for 24 hours if £5,000 was raised. However, Lord Alan Sugar had donated the sum within minutes in order to 'shut up' Piers. 
In a video message, Lord Sugar said: "£5,000 to silence Piers Morgan for a whole day on Twitter - that’s a bargain - the bargain of the century. 
"Comic Relief send me the bill straight away I’ll pay it immediately. It’s going to be a wonderful day without that nutter clogging up Twitter with his nonsense for the whole day." 
Since that target was met, Piers decided to up the ante. The GMB presenter said: "A little earlier I said I would come off Twitter for a day for Comic Relief if we raised £5,000. 
"Within about seven minutes Lord Sugar, hovering in Florida, had posted a video to say he’d pay the whole thing to shut me up. Piers is known for having a laugh on GMB (Photo: Rex Features) 
"So we then reset and I, in a reckless moment, said I would wear a Tottenham Hotspur shirt, which if you know my football allegiance is the nearest thing to hell imaginable, if viewers raised £50,000." 
Upon hearing the news, the likes of Robbie Savage, Rio Ferdinand, Kevin Pietersen, Holly Willoughby, Bradley Walsh, Jamie Redknapp and Michael Vaughan all confirmed they would donate £1,000 for the cause. 
"My humiliation is looking far more likely than I feared when I recklessly made this pledge," said Piers.
